episodes.title: Podcast Ep 4. Abusive relationships are cults, our brains evolved to stay in
episodes.description:
Here I did a deep dive after about six hours of over contemplated research on how abusive relationships and cults are one in the same and how they all relate back to our primal instinct of survival

Listen to the audio version on Spotify 


Follow me everywhere @MiaAstrel

Here are my sources 

- ICSA (International Cultic Studies Association) recommended books list[9]
- "Abusive relationships function like a cult" (Zawn Substack)[16]
- MIT study: "Primitive brain is 'smarter' than we think"


Reverse Dominance Hierarchies - Rob Henderson's Newsletter https://www.robkhenderson.com/p/reverse-dominance-hierarchies

Hierarchy and the Hunt for Prey: Early Human Ownership (Chapter 1) https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/from-masters-of-slaves-to-lords-of-lands/hierarchy-and-the-hunt-for-prey-early-human-ownership/07A5B46421094F9A0FA25ADBBCC931CB

Social Hierarchies: Neural & Psychological Foundations of Status https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC5494206/

Competition, Dominance, and Social Hierarchy - Oxford Academic https://academic.oup.com/edited-volume/28305/chapter/214997186

Dominance, Status and Social Hierarchies https://ecdpeace.org/dominance-status-and-social-hierarchies

Dubreuil's Human Evolution and the Origins of Hierarchies https://www.jasoncollins.blog/dubreuils-human-evolution-and-the-origins-of-hierarchies/

Dominance Hierarchy - an overview | ScienceDirect Topics https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/social-sciences/dominance-hierarchy
The Connection Between Cults and Domestic Violence https://www.domesticshelters.org/articles/identifying-abuse/the-connection-between-cults-and-domestic-violence
